Posts.Content: I've been taking Miralax for just under a year and it causes extreme bloating. and gas buildup that chooses to spread throughout my body vs going out its standard exit. I do have fairly regular bowel movements, but the bloating and gas buildup refuse to exit in a regular fashion. I'm taking 10 Hydromorphone (8mg) per day and 2 Oxycontin (20mg) per day. Any suggestions for a friendlier laxative that work without extreme side effects? Thank you.

Posts.Content: I'm Robert, and was diagnosed with stage four prostate cancer just about two months ago. Appears, I'm in the right place for ventilating and getting new perspectives. I'm 65, and cancer is nothing new to my realm of living, and really not new as an invader of my body. I was told eight years ago, I had an enlarged prostate...and being a tad on the arrogant side combined with a disdain for the medical industry, I elected not to follow up. To think, I pride myself on sound judgement. However, given my reckless lifestyle these last fifty years, I'm surprised to even be alive. That said, I look forward to future exchanges with my comrades in cancer. My favorite saying: "Today, is the first day of the rest of your life." Charles E. "Chuck" Dederich, Sr., (1913–1997)

Posts.Content: Thanks for the insight, Fairwind. With several family members in the medical field, I get a lot of information. I don't dwell on prognoses' very well. I'm pretty much following the regimen dictated by the 3-4 doctors involved, and enjoying each day. Hope not to offend, but in my situation, I wish there was a Dr Kervokian to consult with. When I determine, my body has run its intended course, it would be nice to have an expert to explain the different options. I'm troubled--in some states it's referred to as "assisted suicide". Fortunately, I have fundamental skills in these mundane applications. We obviously go through a subtle form of denial.

Radiation followed, soon afterwards (10 treatments), and I have sincce regrouped somewhat. I'm on a regimen of several meds, including a shot in the rear that is supposed to last four months in controlling the proliferation. The jargon and medical analogies, leaves me confused. Not to mention the morphine and oxycondones. My psa at last count, dropped to 100.
